dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the backseat lies TWO FULL TRASHBAGS open enough to se the contents: PAPER RINGS LINKED IN A LONG CHAIN. On each sheet of folded paper we can make out HANDWRITING. The wind jostles them as the car speeds down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVAN (30) carries the bags from his car to the bin. One goes in easy. The other TEARS so he has to scoop up t tangled paper chain by hand. It clumps like intestines. LUCAS and PETER, both 12, bike down the alley. Lucas head toward Evan who’s getting back in the car. Peter hesitate

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Lucas. Peter listens from a distance. Lucas is at the car window

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: When can we come over? You know. Come ove-

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I get it. Couple weeks. We’1l see. Peter doesn’t get it. The hatchback takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan scans through the aisles, hunting for a certain flow He rubs his fingers on the GREEN LEAF of one. Not it. Another shows more promise, an ORCHID. He scrapes a leaf wollen KNIFE, producing a TURQUOISE POWDER, fine like He grabs a handful of the plant’s soil and sifts through Then another handful until he finds a TINY WHITE INCHWORM

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: He buys four of the potted orchids at the checkout.  Revision 1 2. EXT. EVAN’S HOUSE/ BACK YARD - DUSK He pulls the last of the plants from its pot, shakes the dirt off the roots, and throws it in a fire. He dumps the pot soil onto a SIFTER and starts shaking it leaving behind rocks, twigs, and SEVERAL WHITE INCHWORMS. INT. EVAN’S HOUSE/ BACK ROOM - NEXT - DUSK TwO EMPTY GLASS JARS sit on the desk. One has a HAPPY FAC sticker, the other a FROWN with X’s for eyes. Evan scans over the sifter, picking up worm after worm. One SQUIRMS in his palm. He throws it in the happy jar. Another lies STILL. Dead. It goes in the frown jar. Behind him, an OLD MAN, GILL plays ONLINE POKER. EXT. EVAN’S HOUSE/ BACK PORCH - NIGHT Peter cautiously bikes in to see Lucas amusing a group of TEENAGERS. He’s positioning an older boy, MONTY, in the middle of the porch then gets him to down a shot of BLACK LIQUID. Lucas pours himself a shot from his TRAVEL MUG, downs it, shakes out his arms, and puts his hands over Monty’s eyes

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Close ’em. Close ya eyes. Just trust. Monty does. Lucas stands at his side and prepares. Lucas slowly raises his right hand, swirls his index fing Monty’s right hand MIMICS the motion in perfect unison. Lucas gets more creative, making hand gestures, using bot arms. Monty, eyes closed, instantly matches move for move He’s a PUPPET. Lucas gestures to the others: LUCAS (cont’d) Go ahead. Throw it up. Throw it. Someone throws a BALL at Monty who smacks it down, controlled by Lucas. Then a STICK, EMPTY CAN, etc. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: Revision 1 3. Lucas stands facing Monty so that their every move is a mirror opposite (not mirrored, get it?). They poke each other’s shoulders, play-smack each other’s face, like an extremely complex game of patty cake. Lucas stops when he sees Peter. LUCAS (cont’d) Wait, wait. Peter. Peter! Come here! Peter’s left-handed. He’s a lefty. INT. EVAN’S HOUSE/ BACK ROOM - NEXT - NIGHT Evan sits back, allowing Lucas to run the process at the desk and show off for Peter. He grabs a live inchworm fro the DOZEN in the happy jar and references the 100 dead on in the frown jar:

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: See how many you gotta go through to get a good one? He puts it on a COCKTAIL STRAINER and pours PEPSI over th worm, letting it collect in a shot glass for Peter. Lucas moves the worm and strainer to his own mug while... LUCAS (cont’d) Pete’s a bit of a germaphobe so let me get mine going and I’1l show there’s nothing- Peter’s not going to be pushed so he just downs it fast. Lucas looks up, surprised. He doesn’t see the worm fall THROUGH the strainer into his mug. Behind them, Gill does

dialogues.speaker: GILL
dialogues.text: Hey, boy! Watch that.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got it. I know. See, I know. Nobody wants that. Come here little guy.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: No, no. Just throw-

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: No, I know. Throw this batch out. That’s that. I know. See. Start over.  Revision 1 4. He pours out the mug, wipes it with a napkin. EXT. EVAN’S HOUSE/ BACK PORCH - NEXT - NIGHT Lucas faces Peter. The others watch. Peter’s nervous.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No. He looks around, embarrassed to be the center of attentio Lucas throws up a jab. Peter instantly mirrors him with a jab of his own. Their fists meet. He’s shocked. It’s involuntary. Lucas throws random jabs, slaps, and hooks, all met by Peter, moving in perfect unison. Now he’s enjoying it, laughing. It doesn’t stop even as they talk and the other CHEER. PETER (cont’d) How are you doing it?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I’m not. You are.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’m not. You are.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS AND PETER
dialogues.text: I’m not you are. You’re doing it. You are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas applauds NOELA (11) as she does cartwheels in the grass.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: They hold each other, leaning against a boulder. She shar his mug. He whispers something in her ear and... Without hesitation she walks out on a NARROW WALL of concrete jutting from the hillside. The fall would be 30 feet. She doesn’t seem to care. Nearby, Peter watches, getting worried. He panics, moving to help as she prepares for a cartwheel (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: Revision 1 5. But when she places the first hand down she suddenly wake up to the danger, wobbles, steadies herself. She steps back... ...and comes right after Lucas, violently SLAPPING at him

dialogues.speaker: NOELA
dialogues.text: The hell’s...wrong...with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1000 RACERS move through the suburbs. One racer, JEFF, passes by a man with a DOG on the roadside, BRENT.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Watch your dog.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Get your dog out of the road. Jeff stops, comes back, dithers, before finally approachi JEFF (cont’d) Where you from? You from here?

dialogues.speaker: BRENT
dialogues.text: That’s my house. Jeff takes off, blowing off the odd feeling he seems to have. Brent calls after him: BRENT (cont’d) Where are you from? Jeff waves it off, runs away:

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Nothing. Nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: KRIS (30, LONG DARK HAIR) runs in a stream of racers. She slows to a stop, answers her ear bud phone, turns the opposite way so the race flows around her. Something’s wrong: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 11 12 CONTINUED: Revision 1 6.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Say that again, what? You can see what? Whose? No, not til Monday. Whose is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN OTHER-WORLDY CREATURE gallops across like a horse. Aft a few feet the movement REPEATS: it’s a VIDEO CLIP playing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .»..0N a monitor in front of Kris, now in OFFICE DRESS. S in one cubicle of many, on the phone:

dialogues.speaker: KRIS, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: You can see his foot. A grip, gaffer, I don’t know, somebody’s foot, a shadow. Right but if I can see it they’re going to see it too. Ok I’m going to ask five people around me if they notice and if one-

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ROTH (40) leans against her cubicle wall.

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: Cut them loose. Hire another team. You can’t keep having the same conversation with them. what do you think? She ponders.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: I think they were the best of the lot and the rest aren’t great...and I can’t keep having the same conversation with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finishes a salad at the bar, scanning 12 INDEX CARDS fanned out in front of her. Each card lists a different visual effects house, number of employees, etc. and is paper-clipped to ARTWORK depicting the creature we saw on her monitor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13 14 CONTINUED: Revision 1 7.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: It has been a while- I’m sorry about that, but you’re work is just amazing. When we saw your take on it everyone knew instantly we found the right place. I do have a couple questions- INT. EVAN’S HOUSE/ BACK ROOM - DUSK Evan sets aside TWO CAPSULES from a TYLENOL bottle... .carefully opens one, empties the medicine... .places an inchworm inside, recloses the halves... -marks a TINY DOT on the capsule with a pen. He holds the tampered and untampered capsules up to the light, comparing them before they both go in a SMALL BAGG

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (OFF SCREEN)
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in a back booth, he’s showing her the baggy under the table discreetly. He’s coy, flirting. She is too.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: You have more?

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: One for me. One for you.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: My friends though. This disappoints him, but he doesn’t let her see. Recovering:

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: When are they coming? She lazily points across the room. They’re already there. EVAN (cont’d) Let me check if I can get more. He scoots out of the booth. She didn’t hear him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee te OF  15 16 17 18 CONTINUED: Revision 1 8.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: What? Where are you going? He’s done with her so why not...

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: You got wine breath. Go brush your teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks through the crowd, scanning faces, hunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaning against the wall, he hangs the baggy just outside his jean pocket, trying to get the attention of a man ina SUIT. Suit ignores him. Evan shakes it off, dismayed. He leaves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a BROWN GROCERY SACK from his car, tests out a TASER, and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Kris to a back hallway where the restrooms are. She tries the women’s, but it’s locked. She waits, checks her phone, flicks through messages. Beyond her... ...Evan waits outside the men’s. He approaches with his phone out to show her:

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Are you getting a signal in here? Got a new phone and I can’t tell if it’s me or- She looks over, but it doesn’t matter because now he’s cl enough to jam a TASER under her ribs. She seizes up and collapses against the wall. In one practiced move he puts the taser away and cradles in one arm. She looks like any other drunk girl.  19 Revision 1 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exit door BANGS OPEN. He lays her on the pavement. She’s gasping for breath, no able to make a sound. He retrieves the GROCERY SACK from behind a dumpster and sits on her chest as he unpacks a RESUSCITATOR. He places it over her mouth and twists the valve. WATER starts to drip. He squeezes the resuscitator bag that we see is full of liquid. It flows into her, forcing her to swallow. For an instant we see an INCHWORM in the tube before it disappears into her mouth. She swallows one last time. He takes the device away, allowing her to breathe. He stands up like he’s just rope calf. She gasps, crawling to her knees. She stumbles to her fee trying to escape down the alley. He grabs her PURSE from the ground and slowly follows, keeping his distance, observing. A subtle transformation takes place: Her panic ebbs until she is walking casually, unsure of h own motivation. She suddenly veers off, but Evan corrects her:

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: No no. Come on. This way. She obeys. By the time they reach the heavy foot traffic the main street, she is more like a companion than victim

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Turn left here. She does. They enter the thick congestion of people. EVAN (cont’d) Hold onto my belt. Take your purse. She does. He leads. They are just another couple on a dat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 21 22 Revision 1 10. INT. KRIS’ CAR - NEXT - NIGHT Evan rides in the back seat, scanning Kris’ house as they pull into the long driveway. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ OFFICE - NEXT - NIGHT At the desk Evan thumbs through bills, financial statemen etc. He sets aside blank "BALANCE TRANSFER CHECKS". He opens her checkbook to see the balance: "$5189.23". He checks his watch, thinks. He pulls a PAPERBACK copy of "WALDEN" from his back pocket, rests it on the desk. He taps the cover while scanning the room. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ HALLWAY CLOSET - NEXT - NIGHT He pulls out various BOARD GAMES, looking for something. He finds a case of POKER CHIPS, tucks it under his arm. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ FOYER - NEXT - NIGHT KRIS’ BARE FEET are within ONE WHITE TILE of the tiled floor. She stands, relaxed, almost nodding off against the wall. Evan SNAPS his fingers:

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: No no. Stay awake. You feel refreshed.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Is there food?

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: All the food is poisoned. You’re throat is parched. Go to the kitchen. Make a pitcher of ice water. Bring a small glass. She looks to the kitchen and then to her feet, confused.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: You can leave the tile. The rest of the floor will support your weight now.  23 24 Revision 1 11. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ LIVING ROOM - NEXT - NIGHT The PITCHER and GLASS rest on the table. Kris sits.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: I have to apologize. I was born with a disfigurement where my head is made of the same material as the sun. It makes it impossible for you to look directly at me. It has always been this way. Kris is hit with a FLOOD OF LIGHT. She squints, turns awa Evan’s head is a BRIGHT LIGHT, illuminating the room. He pours a tiny amount of water into the glass. EVAN (cont’d) The water before you is somehow special. When you drink it you feel revived and full of energy. It is better than anything you have ever tasted. Take a drink now. She does, surprised at how good it is. He pours again.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: There are two approaching armies: hunger and fatigue. But a great wall keeps them at bay. The wall extends to the sky and will stay up until I say otherwise. Each drink is better than the last, leaving you with a desire to have one more. Take a drink now. She does, immediately eyeing the pitcher, wanting more. EVAN (cont’d) The next drink must be earned and I’m going to tell you how. Focus closely on my instructions. I will ask you to repeat them from memory. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ BEDROOM - DAWN Evan sleeps alone in Kris’ bed. His phone alarm BEEPS. He wakes.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 25 26 Revision 1 12. He plays a few hands of POKER on his phone. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ KITCHEN - NEXT - DAY He scans over a tray of MULTI-COLORED ESPRESSO CAPSULES, trying to pick one. He tries to figure out how to get a capsule into the machine. ESPRESSO pours into a cup. We hear Kris in the next room. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS - DAY She is organizing the poker chips in stacks of 10:

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Ten chip. Ten chip. Eight, nine, ten chip. Three, four, and six, ten chip... She does a quick count of the stacks with her finger. Satisfied, she grabs a nearby SHEET OF PAPER full of her HANDWRITING. She folds it over and adds it as another "li in the CHAIN OF PAPER RINGS she has been constructing all night. She uses a glue stick and then counts while she ho it tight: KRIS (cont’d) One one thousand, two one thousand, three one thousand, four and five and stick... She lets go of the paper, watching to make sure it sticks It does so she gets her treat, filling the glass precisel to a MARKER LINE drawn by hand. It’s barely a sip. She downs the drink and takes a moment to enjoy it before realizing she wants another. She gets back to work.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Evan enters with his coffee and a disconnected TELEPHONE. Kris finishes transcribing a page from "WALDEN" to a shee of blank paper and immediately starts stacking chips. Fir a line of single chips, then two: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revision 1 13. KRIS (cont’d) One chip, one chip, one chip, one, one, one, one chip, one, one, one chip, two chip, two chip, two, one and two chip...

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: The water has lost its appeal. It doesn’t seem as enticing as before. You have no craving for it. She continues her work, but slowly the passion for it goe missing as if she is questioning it for the first time. He places the telephone RECEIVER to his ear as a prop:

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Kris, I’ve just got a call. It’s your mother. She says she’s been taken by several men.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: She says they won’t let her go unless you pay them.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: No. Oh no. Do you have money?

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: No, I don’t. I’m sorry. Can you think of anything? She sounds brave, but I think they’re hurting her.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Mom. I have the house.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: You own the house?

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Not all of it. But I have...I could-

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: What’s the equity?

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Thirty-six thousand. Would that be enough? And coins. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 28 29 30 CONTINUED: Revision 1 14.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Coins? INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ WALK-IN CLOSET - NEXT - DAY She sits in front of a WALL PANEL, very upset, crying:

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: I just. Don’t. Feel. Like I should.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Do you want me to look away? Would that make you feel better? She hesitates. He’s still directly behind her but...

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: I’ve stepped outside. You are comfortable and secure. You have taken control. Confident and empowered. She opens the panel revealing a HANDGUN, PAPERS, and 3 VELVET CASES. Evan sees the gun and eyes Kris, but she’s oblivious to i only removing the cases before returning the panel. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ BATHROOM - NEXT - DAY She’s on the toilet after a night of drinking water. At the counter Evan counts the GOLD COINS in the first ca and then opens the next two cases, also FULL. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ OFFICE - NEXT - DAY PAPERS slide out of the PRINTER entitled: "APPLICATION FO HOME EQUITY LINE OF CREDIT". INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ BEDROOM - NEXT - DAY Evan picks out a WHITE DRESS from Kris’ closet...  31 32 33 34 Revision 1 15. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ DINING ROOM - NEXT - DAY Kris wears the dress, makeup done, beautiful. She finishe filling out the application at the table. Evan checks it and slides a BALANCE TRANSFER CHECK to her

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Five thousand. She fills it out, writes "$5000.00", signs it.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Forty-five hundred. He slides another check to her. She fills it out. EVAN (cont’d) Three thousand. He slides another. INT. KRIS’ CAR - NEXT - DAY She drives. He sits immediately behind her.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Weather is beautiful. You feel like walking a bit so you park a block away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the car he watches her go in from a block away. INT. KRIS’ CAR - NEXT - DAY She drives while relaying a mental transcript:

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: -I give you back your ID? There we are. Current balance is at the bottom. Please allow three to four business days for availability of funds. Is there anything else I can help you with? No, that’s it. Then thank you very much for stopping in Miss Fischer and have a great-  35 36 37 38 Revision 1 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris exits and walks toward the car. INT. KRIS’ CAR - NEXT - DAY Again, while she drives:

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Yes ma’am, may I help you? who can I speak to about a home equity line of credit? I can help you with that. My name is Marie. Please have a seat. I love your broche- INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Kris is alone. She’s lost weight. Her eyes are sunken in. Her busywork has become more elaborate. She CROCHETS with YARN that alternates between WHITE and RED after some length:

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Over and under and through and back and over and under and through and around and over and under and through and back and now you are red. She positions herself in front of the RED PIECES in a gam of CHECKERS. After some thought, she plays, jumping a pie KRIS (cont’d) Crown me. She adds another handwritten page from "Walden" to the ch and pours a sip of water. The chain is now 20 FEET LONG a winds throughout the room. EXT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ BACK PORCH - DAY Evan listens to voicemail on Kris’ phone while playing mo poker on his.

dialogues.speaker: MAN ON PHONE
dialogues.text: Kris, Roth again. I assumed you’ve been sick and maybe called HR instead. Um, I don’t know why you would do that, we need to hear- He hits "delete". Behind him Kris continues her work.  39 40 41 42 Revision 1 17. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ KITCHEN - DAY Evan is making a SANDWICH, slathering CREAM CHEESE. He suddenly notices Kris is standing behind him holding t empty pitcher. Still shielding her eyes from him, she’s staring at the sandwich, salivating.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: The wall is a mile thick and made of rock. Nothing can or ever has gotten through. She moves on to refill her pitcher, but her eyes linger. He thinks on this.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: He fills a LARGE POT with ICE. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ DINING ROOM - NEXT - DAY She’s enjoying a BOWL of ice, blowing over a spoonful, convinced it is hot. The large pot and ladle are on the table. On the wall SHADOWS of tree leaves dance. She laughs at t likes she’s watching a sitcom. Which she is. INT. KRIS’ CAR - DAY Evan waits in the backseat as Kris approaches from the ba She gets behind the wheel, drops an ENVELOPE on the next seat. As they drive off he grabs the envelope, checks the CASH inside, and files it with other envelopes in a SHOEBOX. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ LIVING ROOM - DAY Kris does her busywork. Evan packs the coins in the shoebox... ...puts WALDEN back in his pocket... ...grabs the telephone and pitcher... ...dumps the ice water in the sink... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 44 45 46 CONTINUED: Revision 1 18. ...watches Kris work for one last moment before...

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Kris, the wall has crumbled, fallen down. Her works slows. She sits back. While Evan begins packing the LONG CHAIN OF PAPER RINGS i TRASH BAGS she stands, heading to the kitchen. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ KITCHEN - NEXT - DAY She sits on the floor eating from the refrigerator with t doors wide open. She’s too busy to notice Evan exit throu the front door with the trash bags and shoebox.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: She’s gone. The refrigerator contents have been ransacked and the doors left open. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ BEDROOM - NEXT - DAY She’s in deep sleep, JAM and BITS OF FOOD caked on her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a macro scale we see representations of chemistry, biology, branching, growth. SLENDER TUBULES glide past ea other. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ BEDROOM - NIGHT Still asleep, Kris’ arm UNFURLS and twists seemingly unde its own control until it extends out to the edge of the b One at a time her legs reach out to full extension. On her left calf something that looks like a LARGE VEIN rises against the inside of the skin and ELONGATES toward her foot. The same happens on her left forearm. Her eyes open slowly. Unaware, she turns to her right arm ...to see the LONG WORM rise against the skin.  47

dialogues.speaker: A7A
dialogues.text: 48 Revision 1 19. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ KITCHEN - NEXT - NIGHT Sitting on the floor against the counter Kris frantically tries to push the worm along her ankle with her hand. Wit the other hand she reaches up to a drawer and withdraws a KNIFE. She summons bravery and then CUTS into her leg. She’s abl to pull out the end of the worm, but the more she pulls t more agonizing the pain. With 6 inches of worm in her grip she slices off its end. Immediately, we hear a HIGH-PITCHED TONE. She passes out.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: She’s still lying in the same spot. Unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: She slowly comes to.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: She sits at the refrigerator, EATING fast, DRINKING water She thinks to examine her ankle and sees... The wound is SCABBED OVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 SPEAKERS lay in the bed as the truck heads toward the CITY on a rural road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against the far off CITYSCAPE we isolate a TRUCK. Extendi up from the cab on a POLE is a GANG OF LIGHTS that sudden flips on, lighting the surroundings like a bioluminescent lure.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Alone, WESLEY (50) unloads 10 LARGE SPEAKERS from his tru He lays them face down on the ground in a group. He hits "play" on a TAPE PLAYER next to preamps in the tr bed. GRUMBLING BASS like womb noise plays into the ground He walks away from the setup, a FOLDING CHAIR under his a (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49 CONTINUED: Revision 1 20.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: EARTHWORMS writhe in the mud. Far away Wesley sits in his chair taking notes under a bo light. A VIDEO on his phone shows a CELLIST auditioning i an empty rehearsal hall. After a few bars... He skips to another clip, an OBOIST:

dialogues.speaker: OBOIST, (IN VIDEO)
dialogues.text: My name is Kevin Anderson. I’1l be playing Ilaiyaraja’s score from Dalapathi in G. 3 seconds in, Wesley skips to a FRENCH HORN, TRUMPET, etc HEADLIGHTS approach on the road. He leans to his telescop The car stops. Kris steps out in a nightgown, moving into the field toward the speakers. Wesley packs up. Kris walks almost trancelike, stopping once before continuing. Nearby, more worms writhe on the ground. Dark everywhere. She gets to the speakers. The bass switches off suddenly. The SILENCE wakes her. Wesley hits the truck headlights and moves to her. She raises her arms, showing him CUTS on all her extremities.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: It won’t come out.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: No. Not like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris stands next to a STEEL PLATFORM, a scale for weighin livestock. Fluorescents hum while she looks around nervously. Wesley calibrates the scale then... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 CONTINUED: Revision 1 21.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Ok, go ahead and step on. She does. He marks her weight on a CLIPBOARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on a COT downing a tall glass of a MILKY MIXTURE She eyes Wesley who is marking up the clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: What did you weigh...before the growth?

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: One fifteen. Maybe. Why? All business, he puts another full glass of the mixture i front of her. She grabs it and prepares to drink.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Will you say why?

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: It’s fine. This guy’s 11 pounds.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Is that good? Wesley silently continues writing.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS,
dialogues.text: How long does it take? He pours another glass to a precise level for her. KRIS (cont’d) This’11 kill it? He makes the mistake of looking at her and melts a bit:

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: I can answer all your questions after. Right now there’s no point in telling you. You won’t remember.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Where did it come from? Nothing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 51 52 53 54 CONTINUED: Revision 1 22.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: This will kill it?

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: No. No that won’t. That’s going to make you very sick. We’re making your body a place he doesn’t want to be. Eleven pounds makes him thirty feet long so it’1ll take around three and a half days. He closes his clipboard, set to leave. She’s scared.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t come from anywhere. You people just show up. I’m sure you think you’re awake. You’re not awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wesley puts in EARPLUGS to muffle Kris’ SCREAMS of agony coming from down the hall. He ties TWO RAW BEEF STEAKS together with GAUZE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wesley searches Kris’ extremities: left arm, left leg, ri arm, right leg. That’s where he finds the NUB of the worm head peeking out. He wraps the layers of beef over it. He pulls the cot to the other side of the room for better access, nearly deaf to her screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wesley has prepped an area on the belly of an unconscious PIG for surgery. He washes it with iodine. He begins to cut out a SQUARE SEGMENT with a scalpel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks between the steaks to see the worm has traveled through the first and entered the second. He inserts a WOODEN DOWEL under the worm and manages to l it a few times. He turns the dowel, pulling more of the w from Kris. She screams. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55 56 CONTINUED: Revision 1 23. He wheels the pig into the room on a gurney, positioned n to Kris’ leg. He affixes the second steak, worm still embedded, to the square wound on the pig.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Kris moans, passed out from exhaustion. Wesley pours more mixture, wakes her. She pushes it away, screaming:

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: She looks toward the pig and goes quiet. After some thoug she downs the poison. She has seen: The setup is orderly and running well. The worm goes from her leg, around the dowel (now supported on a stand) a fe times, and then disappears into the pig.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Wesley turns the dowel for the last time, removing the la part of worm from Kris. He wheels the pig out of the room. 12 inches of worm stil protrudes from its wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reading from his notes he adds a line to a page of names serial numbers: "KRIS FISCHER 20110802-Kris" On a SMALL TAG he copies the serial number: "20110802-Kri He PIERCES the pig’s ear with the tag. By now the worm ha crawled further in with only a few inches now left outsid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pig is released into the pen passing others with simi ear tags and first names: "Robert" "Luis" "Paula" etc. The pen holds 50 PIGS. Beyond it is Wesley’s FARMHOUSE.  57 58 59 60 61 Revision 1 24. EXT. KRIS’ HOUSE - DAY Kris calmly walks to the front entrance and opens the doo INT. KRIS’ HOUSE - NEXT - DAY We follow as she passes through the living room, the kitchen, her bedroom. She doesn’t seem to notice the TENS PEOPLE standing idle in every room. She begins to remove her nightgown when she stops, puzzle She calmly steps back to the kitchen to see everyone, but before she can make sense of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris wakes in her car. She has been placed behind the whe The car is parked just off the road. 4 STRIPED TOWERS of oil refinery lie in the distance. For a moment she is frozen in terror, eyes wide. She suddenly takes a huge breath, waking to her surroundings. She nervously checks the backseat, the glove box, the floorboard, looking for any clue to how she got here. A moment of thought leads her to a greater fear: she lift her nightgown and puts a hand in her underwear. She inspe her fingers but nothing is confirmed either way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drives into the parking lot... ...turns off the ignition, about to open the car door but Her hand rests on the HANDLE. She scans people: COPS, VICTIMS, MEN IN HANDCUFFS. She’s hesitating. She starts up the ignition and backs out. EXT. KRIS’ HOUSE - NEXT - DAY She pulls into the driveway, looking for anything suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62 63 64 65 66 CONTINUED: Revision 1 25. She opens the front door and pushes it WIDE OPEN. After checking around corners she quickly takes a few ste in, grabs her CELLPHONE, and retreats back outside. She dials 911 then lets her thumb hover over the CALL button. She wields this as a weapon and enters the house. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE - NEXT - DAY She stands in each room, studying it. The OFFICE... LIVING ROOM... » HALLWAY... . BEDROOM... ...KITCHEN. She crouches near the DRIED BLOOD on the floo The KNIFE lies next to it. She rubs her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: She MOPS and cleans the kitchen. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ BATHROOM - NEXT - DAY Kris showers. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ LIVING ROOM - NEXT - DAY DRESSED for work, PURSE ready, COAT on. She sits on the couch gathering thoughts, contemplating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks with determination through the parking lot towa the front entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris sits before a female MANAGER.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: And did you try anybody else? Because I spoke to Amy and she didn’t remember talking to- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 67 68 69 CONTINUED: Revision 1 26.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: I already said it was voicemail. I left a voice- where is Roth? Today. Why isn’t he telling me himself?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Well he couldn’t be here but that’s not... Kris notices a SECURITY GUARD enter and stand nearby.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: I. Had. The flu. I had a hundred and six temperature!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks to her car, crying and carrying PICTURE FRAMES, MUG, etc. The guard stays behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris is checking out, running her CARD through the SCANNE It’s not working. The CASHIER tries to help but it’s no u Frustration mounts. We’re too far away to hear dialogue. INT. BANK/ INVESTIGATOR’S OFFICE - DAY Kris waits alone. Her older sister MAGGIE stands just outside.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE, (ON CELLPHONE)
dialogues.text: Richie, it’s me. If you’re already on the road I’m sorry, but we’ve got a problem. It’s Kris. Everybody’s safe but you need to call as soon as you can.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Maggie has joined Kris, both seated, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: What time do you have to get back? Kris stares forward, tense. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: Revision 1 27.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Kris, what time?

dialogues.speaker: KRIS,
dialogues.text: I don’t. I quit.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: You quit your job? When?

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Few days ago- last week.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Krissy, why?

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Because. They’re assholes. The bank INVESTIGATOR joins them at his desk with PAPERS.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: He’s placed down a WITHDRAWAL SLIP COPY for them to inspe KRIS (cont’d) ...that’s not even my- that’s forged. That’s not my signature. It’s not. Maggie scrutinizes the handwriting as another paper is sl next to it with an IDENTICAL SIGNATURE: "Kris Fischer".

dialogues.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
dialogues.text: And this is a deposit slip from September.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s my writing. This isn’t though, see? It’s forgery. Maggie compares them: the same. She looks at Kris, perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The Investigator tries to put together a thoughtful response.

dialogues.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
dialogues.text: Coerced. See the problem I’m having is first you say theft then you say your signature is forged. Now we’re at coerced. I have no interest in (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 71 CONTINUED: Revision 1 INVESTIGATOR (cont'd) proving, disproving. Certainly you’ve experienced something. I just know that my ability to help is coming to an end. From the standpoint of the bank there has been no wrongdoing. The three are quiet, unsure how to move on.
The Investigator is about to open a door to let Maggie in a room but first prefaces:

dialogues.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
dialogues.text: I want you to understand this is not something I’m doing because I have to. The notary public remembers her, the tellers remember. But you’ve been very polite and seem genuinely bewildered by this so... He opens the door to a room full of SECURITY CAMERA MONITORS. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Kris stares at PRINTOUTS from the security footage: her a the teller window on separate days, alone. Maggie and their brother Rich (40) sit far away,

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: And one more thing. Dad’s coins are gone. discussing: Rich, already in shock, takes this hard. He can only laug

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: I have a good idea where it went, Maggie! What are we intervening? Is this where we do the whole - because whatever she’s on (to Kris) whatever you’re on I'll write a check right now for the precise amount it would take you to OD. Give me a number!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 73 CONTINUED: Revision 1 29.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Okay, that’s enough.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I know of someone she can talk to. INT. KRIS’ HOUSE/ BATHROOM - NEXT - NIGHT Maggie stares at the wall. Beyond her Kris removes her nightgown and waits to be inspected in her underwear. Maggie turns to Kris, sees the WOUNDS, and instantly has look away. She melts down in a horrified crying grimace.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Baby Krissy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF (35) finds a seat in the front car, heading for work He sits up. Something is off. He looks around. Did he for something? He checks his bag, his wallet. Nothing. His head is drawn toward the rear of the train. He sudden gets up and walks back with his belongings. He moves into the next car back, checking the passengers. Nothing. He has a seat there. Still not right. He gets up again and moves back a car, h hand tracing along the seats. He doesn’t know what he’s after. He enters the fourth car, sees Kris, thinks, sits across aisle from her. Her head rests on the window, headphones eyes closed. Dressed CASUAL, her hair is SHORT BLONDE now He studies her, then her bag, her hands, the floor thinking. She opens her eyes, aware of something but not sure what. She sits up, removes headphones, searches the room, lands Jeff.  74 75 76 Revision 1 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They finish coffee, exchanging business cards. She writes her number on the back. Awkward but full of promise.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: ...address is there. You ever need signage of any kind, just call or come down-

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Never in a million years would I ever need that. Never. But I- this is you?

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: That’s me.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I’1l call. Kris. I don’t have any need for signage. I won’t be calling for signage.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Okay. Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Okay. It was really good meeting you. They depart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different day. Jeff waits for the train. It comes. As it slows to a stop he scans each passenger c looking for someone. He gets on, looks around, exits. The train departs. He waits again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris rides to work, her head in a catalog. SOMETHING quietly draws her attention forward. She lifts eyes, then head, scanning outside.  77 78 Revision 1 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff gives up on another train as it departs. Now it’s hi turn to be drawn. He looks down the empty railway.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A new train is coming to stop. He walks alongside, not ev looking in the windows. He senses which car to enter. He boards and finds a seat across the aisle from Kris who turns back to him even before he arrives. Silence. Jeff catches his breath. Kris is stoic.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I called you. She nods, not giving anything away. JEFF (cont’d) This makes me late for work- I can’t do this everyday. You’re four trains after me. So you’re going to have to answer. If I call- I’m gonna call. Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit near the window. She’s digging through her purse half-listening to...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: ...I picked up an MBA in finance. That’s what the firm does. There’s a commercial side, other half’s personal wealth.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Where is it? [his job]

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You can actually see- see that high-rise? Palomar building? C&L Crowne. That’s us.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Why do you take the train? The purse-digging has become distracting. He goes quiet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 CONTINUED: Revision 1 32.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Everyone on there’s homeless or had their license revoked or...you know.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You want to see my driver’s license? She finally retrieves a PRESCRIPTION PILL BOTTLE and puts on the table between them. After a moment, she explains:

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: That’s a gift for us. He doesn’t know what to do with that.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: There’s this path forward where I wait to tell you. Then maybe you use it as an excuse, maybe you don’t- I don’t know. Last year I was diagnosed bipolar. I take those...and these. And it’s fine. He stands a menu up to hide the bottle. He thinks. KRIS (cont’d) So that’s here now. Saved us at least three to four weeks.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I’1l just get the check and we can get- She’s not amused at his deadpan. He smiles. JEFF (cont’d) I’m sorry. That was stupid. I don’t know what to say to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk leisurely. It’s still a date of some kind.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I’1l tell you...before we pass that trashcan. I’1l have something. They walk in silence, nearing the TRASHCAN. They pass it. It’s not as amusing as he thinks it is. Finally... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: Revision 1 33. JEFF (cont’d) I’m divorced. Is that bad? It is, right?

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: It’s not great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She’s about to step onto an ESCALATOR. They are winding down.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: How’s that work...in movies? We meet- we say we’ll meet tomorrow at a place at noon. Say the taco place at mockingbird. We say we’1l meet and then...

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: If we both show up we know we’re good.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, but how does it work? I show up, you’re not there, that means you don’t want...to try- but how does that help me?

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: And I wouldn’t know if you showed or-

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, no that’s what it is. That’s what it is. I get to feel okay because I know you don’t know...you don’t know I showed up so I don’t feel foolish. I like that.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: I think...Jeff...I’m going to save you some time. Thank you for lunch but... She moves away, gets on the escalator. He smirks, trying be amused at the insult. Instead he gets awkward and a bi angry:

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’11 save you some time. He starts down the stairs, walking alongside her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 80C
dialogues.text: 81 CONTINUED: Revision 1 34. JEFF (cont’d) I’1l save you some time. I know what train you take. Red line. About 8:15, yeah? Save me a seat. He heads back, trying to exit on his own terms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris operates a LARGE INDUSTRIAL PRINTER. She waits for i to finish, getting lost in the drone of the machine, her thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She eats a sandwich on break, watching people. Her hand rests behind her, lingering over the outline of TINY MODE BUILDINGS, which are part of the sculpture. She stays ona particular one:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN to the 30th floor of the HIGH RISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff has his PAPERWORK laid out on a table. People use th VENDING MACHINES behind him. He wakes from a daze and loo across the office floor, his eyes landing on a far away N PLATE that reads "E. ALDERMAN". This means something to h Coincidentally, ALDERMAN steps out and speaks to his secretary before heading away. Jeff watches him go. An INTERN passes Jeff, which reminds him:

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Hey, these FLPs for the realty group, they’1l be done by Thursday, yeah? Cause when we put this in front of them the first thing they’11 ask for is-

dialogues.speaker: INTERN 1
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’1l try. Jeff doesn’t like that answer but is staying friendly: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 83 84 CONTINUED: Revision 1 35.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Can you maybe firm that up?

dialogues.speaker: INTERN 1
dialogues.text: I'll really try. And that’s the best he’s going to get so he resigns:

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plays SCRATCH OFF LOTTERY TICKETS on a trash bin. No luck. He tosses them. He’s about to leave when... ...instead he heads back inside...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Give me two more. Three pick daily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff walks past GUESTS checking in. He removes a FOLDER f his bag, enters a back office, seemingly belonging there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and the hotel owner, RAJ (50s), are poring over FINANCIALS. He digs into a bowl of M&Ms, separating out t BLUE ONES.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Raj, we have clients with ten times this revenue that don’t have near tax liability you do. So we can have another talk about how screwed up the code is or you can take the charge against and solve it. CLOSER on the M&Ms, his hand stabbing into them.

dialogues.speaker: RAJ
dialogues.text: But the downtown hotel is profitable.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: They all are. This is fiscal, just the quarter. You want to be right? Or rich? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 86 87 CONTINUED: Revision 1 36. CLOSER STILL on the M&Ms. He stabs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND picks up STRAY CONCRETE BITS off the bottom of the pool. Kris is swimming, hovering, scanning, searching the pieces. Alone, quiet, small in the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLERK is checking Jeff in. It’s informal. Clerk is more interested in a COWORKER’S story...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Can I. Jim. Jimmy. Is there a window room?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: They all have windows.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I mean not facing the alley. Raj passes by, gives Jeff a goodbye pat on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is dark and closed for the night. Jeff sneaks behind the counter and snatches a BOX OF STRAWS. INT. CHAIN HOTEL/ JEFF’S ROOM - NEXT - NIGHT He opens the door, enters, unpacks.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: He dumps the straws in a pile on the desk and begins work Our view is from behind him so we can’t see what he’s doi

dialogues.speaker: MATCH CUT
dialogues.text: 88 89 Revision 1 37. INT. WESLEY’S FARMHOUSE/ MUSIC ROOM - DAY Wesley listens to a symphonic score on HEADPHONES. The ro contains mics, synths, etc. He shakes his head, aggravate

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Incredible. What are you doing? What are you doing? Goddamn it, what are you doing? INT. WESLEY’S FARMHOUSE/ LIVING ROOM - DAY He studies SHEET MUSIC. Now a stereo BLARES the score.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: I mean what is this? I don’t ever want - He shuts the music off.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: These eight, nine notes are poison. The refrain. I can’t hear it again. Anathema. We realize he’s speaking with someone on SPEAKERPHONE:

dialogues.speaker: SPEAKERPHONE
dialogues.text: Don’t know what to say. To my ears there-

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Okay, look. I’m going to clean this up, send a new version in the morning. For now, please, for my own sanity, take a giant black marker and redact bars...9-13...22-26...no 28...35-37. He rifles through sheet music, circling the appropriate bars.

dialogues.speaker: SPEAKERPHONE
dialogues.text: Done. I’1l toss the lot. What it’s worth I think it’s fine, but do what you need to. Wesley is already moving away, ready to hang up.  90 91 92 93 94 95 96 Revision 1 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He purposefully steps to the gate, waits. He scans the varying clusters of pigs intently.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: He slowly walks through the pen, looking from pig to pig. He passes one and lowers his hand like he’s feeling a breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DESKWORKER sits at his desk alone, typing, reading, etc WESLEY’S HAND passes by as if he’s walking along the cubicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wesley moves on to the next pig, stands next to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COMMUTER drives in thick traffic, alone in his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wesley crouches next to the pig, studying its face and ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Wesley is in the passenger seat, watching the Commute

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN eats lunch at a table alone, watching people. NEW ANGLE: Wesley sits across from her. She doesn’t notic He gets up to leave, unsatisfied. She continues, unaware.  97 98 99 100 Revision 1 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wesley stands from a seated position and crouches near another pig, pulling its collar to inspect its face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands on the sidewalk. A SHOPPER turns to face a wind near him, moving her head just like the pig did when pull He "releases" her and she moves down the sidewalk. He tur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns. Something is drawing him in. He steps away. RED LIGHTS flash against his face as he approaches a pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUSBAND worriedly watches EMTs push his WIFE on a gurne into an AMBULANCE, lights FLASHING. He’s in shock. A PLAS SHOPPING BAG hangs from his fingers. Among the ONLOOKERS behind him, Wesley arrives. An EMT interviews a NEIGHBOR woman:

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: I had seen her earlier from my kitchen- she was weeding her garden and when I looked back she’s lying on the ground and I knew something was wrong. I ran to the fence and kept yelling "Jill! Jill!" but she just wouldn’t...you know... EMT talks to Husband:

dialogues.speaker: EMT
dialogues.text: -taking any kind of medication? She have a health condition of any kind?

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND
dialogues.text: No. I mean, asthma. But just asthma. Neighbor gently takes the plastic bag from Husband: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 101 102 103 104 CONTINUED: Revision 1 40.

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: Let me take that. You’11l go with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance speeds down the road. Husband watches the E work on Wife. Wesley sits far in back, watching it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wesley has brought out his lawn chair, his notebook, and small SYNTH PAD. He sits next to the pig, composing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Husband sits, wide-eyed, worried, staring, thinking. Wesl sits behind him on the opposite side of the row of chairs back to back, keeping close. He begins to hear FAINT VOIC He leans near Husband’s head and the VOLUME increases:

dialogues.speaker: WIFE, (OFF SCREEN)
dialogues.text: I wanted to say that I hope today is better and that I love you. Closer still and he can see Husband’s thoughts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Husband is trying to leave, his hand on the doorknob. Wif pleads with him. Their clothes tell us it’s earlier today

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: And I made a list of the things I want to try harder at. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Jillian. That doesn’t fix anything. Just words. I gotta go. He opens the door and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: In the den, Husband unscrews a light fixture, checks the BULB. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: Revision 1 41. HUSBAND (cont’d) Shit. He walks to the front door. Wife is in the kitchen. HUSBAND (cont’d) Yeah, they’re halogen. I got to run up and get a pack.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: Wait a second. He pauses as she approaches, something on her mind:

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND
dialogues.text: Oh, now you want to talk...I’m headed out the door?

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: I just want to say that I hope today is better and that I do love you. We’re back where we started. Except slightly different:

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND
dialogues.text: Damn it, Jill. This is worthless. Doesn’t fix anything. I’1l be back. He opens the door. Steps out. CUT TO: 10 seconds ago: He’s at the door. She walks to him. HUSBAND (cont’d) Leave me alone, Jillian. Not now.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: I want this to be a good day. I love you. He opens the door. It repeats again: WIFE (cont’d) I think you were right about a lot of things and I hope today is peaceful -

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND
dialogues.text: It’s just words. Doesn’t fix anything. He relives variations of this dialogue over and over.  105 106 107 108 109 110 Revision 1 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Husband is still piecing it together. Then one more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out again. This time it plays out longer: He gets half way to the car, scanning the front lawn. He turns back to see her waiting in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND
dialogues.text: I’1l get some washers for that sprinkler head. All right? She nods. He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE holds the door open, letting Husband into the roo There is no urgency. Wife is still. An INTEBATION TUBE ha been removed. Husband stays at the foot of the bed. Against the wall Wesley is near tears, connected emotionally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’s picking out notes on the synth. Chord structures loo and grow, heightening to a crescendo. Then he stops it all except for one SMALL REPEATING NOTE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Husband has arrived back at his home. He sits upright on couch alone, staring, in shock. The note stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wesley leans over in his chair, drained. Finished.  111 112 Revision 1 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff walks in, scans the counter. Kris isn’t there.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ROOM
dialogues.text: She’s on a break talking to a coworker. We can see Jeff w up front. Her head suddenly lifts a bit. Without looking knows he’s near. It’s a pleasant thought. She dwells on it...

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: I need to go up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris and Jeff sit at the rear of car, watching a WOMAN KN

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: She’s a...former Senator. Nobel winner. But her category was mittens. And she just never found a way to monetize it so she takes the train. Continues her research. They play a game, guessing what’s wrong with people. A MA

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: He’s divorced. Cause she cheated. She checks Jeff’s response. It’s a subtle: No.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Or he did. He cheated. No. KRIS (cont’d) He has these anger issues, couldn’t cope. Hmmm. Interesting but no. KRIS (cont’d) Alcoholic. Wow, close. KRIS (cont’d) No, but a substance of some kind. An illegal kind. He admits it with silence.  Revision 1 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk away from the station into the night.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: I would think there are some marriages that could survive that. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Maybe. But...

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Not yours.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Not ours. From her perspective everything flipped just like that. The guy she thought she married turned out to be somebody else, a junkie basically. The savings she thought we were building, the plans, reset to zero. Lights turn on. I’m on a bender holed up ina hotel in Reno.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: You do a program or something?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: At ACS. See? Problem, solution. Done and done. And you thought you weren’t into me. 114 EXT. KRIS’ RUNDOWN APARTMENT - NEXT - NIGHT She’s trying to say goodnight. He’s not. They hover close

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: I have to open the store.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Not that early. I bet...

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: No, I’m lucky to have that job.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: The sign store job. You’re lucky? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115 116 117 118 CONTINUED: Revision 1 45.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: It’s not my fault when it goes wrong.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yes it is. INT. KRIS’ RUNDOWN APARTMENT/ KITCHEN - NEXT - NIGHT They kiss, getting aggressive.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: They’re asleep in her bed. On Jeff’s left and Kris’ right ankle we see MATCHING SCAR a circle with an odd "+" in the middle. We crane above Kris and Jeff until we see they are now no on the bed at all but instead on a bed sheet laid on the.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...GROUND. They stay asleep, surrounded by pigs. PAN OVER to see Wesley pushing a WHEELBARROW to the pen. He pours several bags of feed into the TROUGH. As the pig jockey for position, he tosses in some BROWN BANANAS, etc The pigs FEAST greedily. INT. KRIS’ RUNDOWN APARTMENT/ KITCHEN - MORNING SCRAMBLED EGGS SIZZLE in a pan. They make breakfast. Jeff butters toast, gets jam from the fridge. Kris’ eyes follow him back and forth. When he gets close she lunges him for a brief kiss, almost desperate. Then nervous. INT. CHAIN HOTEL/ JEFF’S ROOM - NIGHT They enter the room. Jeff shows her around.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS, (OFF SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Why do you live in hotels? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 119 CONTINUED: Revision 1 46.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF, (OFF SCREEN)
dialogues.text: I do the books for a group that owns a few of them so...it’s sort of a perk. She’s sitting on the bed, her jacket still on, not comfortable. He reads a room service menu.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Right but why do you choose to?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Are you hungry? You got to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads her by the hand to the back entrance to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The place is empty. They eat burgers they made themselves

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: They always remind me of family vacations. I think it’s the smell, the chlorine or bleach on the sheets. Glasses in plastic.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: There was this place in Vermont we would go when we were kids. It was some sort of colonial historical site- museums and you know...but what stands out is the hotel we would stay at had an indoor pool and this was just the biggest deal in the world for us, for my brothers. I mean indoor...and you can swim. We would lose it. She looks at him, almost troubled, scrutinizing. JEFF (cont’d) What? What are you thinking? She waves it off. Nothing.  120 121 122 Revision 1 47. EXT. WESLEY’S FARMHOUSE - DAY Wesley is bringing in GROCERIES from the car. He sees something in the pen that causes him to halt for a second He watches before moving on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches with a BAG OF PEANUTS, eating a few. He sto at the fence, watching... In a corner of the pen TWO PIGS, K and J have isolated themselves from the others. K lies down and J looks like he’s standing guard. Wesley moves to them while staying outside the fence. He throws a couple peanuts on the ground. J gobbles them up. Wesley throws some more, this time closer to the rest of pigs. J moves in that direction but won’t go past a certa point. Other pigs finally come for the peanuts. J gives t a LOW GRUNT, warding them off. Wesley’s not happy with th

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: No! No! He throws the whole bag, trying to coax J away from K. WESLEY (cont’d) Go. Go! Get! INT. CHAIN HOTEL/ JEFF’S ROOM - MORNING Jeff’s cell phone BUZZES on the desk, a message. From the bed Kris notices and looks to the bathroom where Jeff is showering.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Out and dressed now, he’s putting on a tie.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: You have a message.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you. He checks it. She waits. He goes back to getting ready. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123 124 125 CONTINUED: Revision 1 48.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Are you going? For a second he pretends to not understand, but:

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: To the banquet.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oh, you know. It’1l be like work. It’s people from work. For three hours. Feels like...work. He sees she was hoping for a different answer... JEFF (cont’d) I thought we could go though. If you want. She tries to hide how happy this makes her. JEFF (cont’d) Do you want to? Yes, more than anything but she can only nod and smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris, DRESSED for the party, enjoys the ride DOWNTOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff waits for her, keeping an eye on the front. A COWORKER approaches, introduces his DATE, heads inside. Jeff stays, waiting, thinking, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi arrives. Jeff opens the door for Kris and pays. takes in the hotel, ready to walk in... ...but he needs to talk, points away from the hotel and.. ...leads her by the hand across the street, dodging traffic...  Revision 1 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They’re at a small table. Kris waits for him to speak as nervously removes the PAPER WRAPPERS from straws.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I...I like you so much.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Shit. You kidding me? I bought a dress- He holds up a hand to keep her calm. She’s got the wrong idea.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I have been very careful not to...lie. But through omission you may have gotten the wrong- I gave you a different impression than is...real. And if we walk into that hotel you’re gonna know. Kris looks to the door like she might bolt. She doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I’m not an advisor. I don’t broker. I do...interdepartmental reports.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: That still sounds impressive-

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: It’s not. I work with interns. Alongside interns. Craig pays me in cash to keep me off their books cause if there was an audit I’ma liability. Kris almost smiles, relieved, but still wonders...

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: I don’t...what does that last part mean-

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I stole money, Kris. From a client. Shifted it from account to account until I could grab it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 128 CONTINUED: Revision 1

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Because of...Reno?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Lost my broker’s license. And they covered for me but if I was anybody else, didn’t have a relationship with Craig or his brother I’d be in prison. I’m lucky to have that job.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: License. 50. She stares at his hands. He has made a CHAIN with the str wrappers like she made with Evan. But she doesn’t remembe

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: That was smart...waiting to tell me. Cause what am I gonna do now?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: I think you might be using that wrong. INT. CHAIN HOTEL/ JEFF’S ROOM - DAWN Jeff sleeps. Kris pours a cup of room service coffee.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: She sits near his feet, drinking, looking at his ankle, t WORM SCAR. She’s not alarmed. She’s seen it before. a finger over her own, grazes his. He stirs.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Morning. She stays on his ankle, in a daze....

dialogues.speaker: KRIS,
dialogues.text: I might be pregnant. INT. WESLEY’S FARMHOUSE - NIGHT She runs Wesley holds headphones to one ear and a cellphone to the other, discussing the symphony with someone: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 129 CONTINUED: Revision 1 51.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: They’re not following the composition, they’re following what they played last season or a year before...right they ARE professional so they should be able to read the page without bringing their own- yes, I know. Tomorrow then. Good night. He hangs up, continues playback, but then stops it, listening: LOUD PIG GRUNTS erupt from outside. WOOD BREAKING. He steps to the window, flips on the lights over the pen. He scans with binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He carries a few 8-foot lengths of wood to the fence. He inspects the damage: CRACKED FENCE POST and BOARDS. He looks into the pen: K and J still isolated from the re He starts repairs, pulling off the damaged wood.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Wesley walks with a VET into the pen toward K and J.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: ...won’t let anyone near them. They crowd back in the corner. Violent...

dialogues.speaker: VET
dialogues.text: If I had to guess...here get him, hold him back...if I had to guess...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Vet is feeling K’s belly. Wesley holds J back with rope. VET (cont’d) Yeah, she has a litter on the way. They can get very protective. Might explain. But you’ve had litters here? Surely. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: Revision 1 52.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, just never had them break my damn fence. Never seen the parents behave so... Vet is scanning the pen, seems to have a question. WESLEY (cont’d) No, I don’t keep them around. Wesley wants this conversation over, starts heading back.

dialogues.speaker: VET
dialogues.text: Well, I was going to say if you ever -

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: There’s a fellow down the way buys them off me.

dialogues.speaker: VET
dialogues.text: I see. If you do need another buyer I know a petting farm always needs piglets...

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, sure, sure. Thank you so much. 130 INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE/ EXAMINATION ROOM - DAY Kris sits in a gown across from a female OBGYN.

dialogues.speaker: OBGYN
dialogues.text: First off. You...are not pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: No, I took a test. I am.

dialogues.speaker: OBGYN
dialogues.text: Well, you can’t always trust those. And the HCG in your blood tells us that you are not. So that’s more definitive. Kris isn’t buying this. Pompous doctors...

dialogues.speaker: KRIS,
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: OBGYN
dialogues.text: Now I want to make sure we have correct records. You didn’t list it (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 131 CONTINUED: Revision 1 53. OBGYN (cont’d) in your questionnaire, but have you had any surgical procedures on your pelvic area?

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: No. I would have put that down.

dialogues.speaker: OBGYN
dialogues.text: Maybe a cyst was removed? Biopsy? Kris shakes her head no. Why is she asking?

dialogues.speaker: OBGYN
dialogues.text: Okay. Obgyn exits politely, leaving Kris with questions. She ca hear Obgyn in the hall telling a nurse:

dialogues.speaker: OBGYN, (OFF SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Let’s get her a pelvic CT and white cell count. Put...sonogram inconclusive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obgyn consults with a COLLEAGUE in front of MONITORS show CT SCANS. They point to a DARK VOID on the screen:

dialogues.speaker: COLLEAGUE
dialogues.text: I’d say post cancer. This is where they removed the tumor, this cavity.

dialogues.speaker: OBGYN
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm. She says no.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEAGUE
dialogues.text: No what? Someone was in there. Trauma here...and here.

dialogues.speaker: OBGYN
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm. How are you supposed to help someone like that?  132 133 134 135 136 137 138 Revision 1 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris is on the table, unconscious, wearing an anesthesia mask. Obgyn makes an INCISION on her abdomen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff paces. He stops, alert to something beyond a far wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LAPARASCOPE is fed into the cut. A nearby MONITOR shows live video of the probe’s progress

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated now, he’s having a bad reaction, breathing heavily

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurries across the street to a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TwO EMPTY SHOT GLASSES sit before him. He downs a third a orders a fourth. It’s settling him.

dialogues.speaker: OBGYN, (OFF SCREEN)
dialogues.text: By all appearances, and this is Doctor Pear’s opinion as well, you are a survivor of stage three endometrial cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris recovers in bed. Obgyn sits across from her:

dialogues.speaker: OBGYN
dialogues.text: The good news is there’s no sign of any remaining carcinoma. Labs show you’re in no immediate danger. But the trauma it left behind is significant. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 139 140 141 CONTINUED: Revision 1 55.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Alone, Kris changes out of the gown into clothes.

dialogues.speaker: OBGYN, (OFF SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Well, I’m saying two things. It is highly unlikely given the state of the organs that you could ever become pregnant and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris wanders to the exit, trancelike, despondent.

dialogues.speaker: OBGYN, (OFF SCREEN)
dialogues.text: ...if by some miracle you were to conceive, the faculties are too damaged to carry a baby to term.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff rides, scanning. He sees Kris walking, tells cabbie:

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Here, here, pull over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns a corner to start up the stairs to the platform Jeff comes after her, desperate:

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Krissy! Krissy! He runs up. She falls into him, breaks down. JEFF (cont’d) Why’d you go? I looked for you. KRIS. I’m broken. Something happened to me...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I know. I don’t care. I don’t care.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: No, you don’t know. I pretended to show you how bad it is that it couldn’t be worse but it’s so much (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 142 CONTINUED: Revision 1 56. KRIS (cont’d) worse. I can’t see my niece and nephew. I started off with promise and could do things and accomplish but it was all a trick-

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Why can’t you see them? Why?

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: I’m not allowed, Jeff! I. flipped. over. My whole beginning was a fake out. This is who I’ve always been. How are you not seeing that?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I don’t see it! I don’t see it. I need to marry you. I’m marrying you. I want a house and- I’m married to you. Right now. There’s only us.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: I’m broken.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I don’t care. I don’t care. You're the only one who knows me. I’m going to be so much better for you. I’m going to get a ring, we’re going to get all the things we’re supposed to. And we’re going to-

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Can we get a car? He smiles. Right now he’d do anything.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Kris sit in a BEAT-UP TERCEL with "FOR SALE" painted on the window. It’s stopped at a FORK in the road near the 4 striped towers where Wesley left Kris.  Revision 1 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff looks around, trying to form an answer to:

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Do you know this place?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I want to say yes for you. I want to.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Let me...if you had to pick a direction, one of these roads here...is there one you feel more...drawn to?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Do you? She wants his answer first. He looks again, really trying He checks her face for clues and subtly gestures to the left. This makes her happy. He must have guessed correctly. The car takes off down the left road.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: They pull into the next fork in the road:

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Which way do you think? I say right.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I say...right. She looks at him. He looks back: what?

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Don’t just say what I say and don’t let my vote affect yours.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Okay. What about you? You can’t let-

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: -and I won’t let yours affect mine. He smirks, not seeing how that’s going to work. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 144 CONTINUED: Revision 1 58.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: They pull into the next fork. They write down their choices on INDEX CARDS and compare: "left" and "left". They go left.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Next fork. Index cards: "right" and "right". It’s working

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Kris’s expectations are dashed. The cards: "right" and "left". She gets out, looking for clues on the horizon. From the car:

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Maybe you feel stronger than me. So we should just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff sits at a computer, browsing Craigslist for houses. screen is an AD with pictures of a SUBURBAN HOUSE. He flicks the mouse and 12 ADS FAN OUT. The ICON travels over them until another is selected. On the next page we the text: "2221 Point Merit" and "Call Danny". Jeff searches "2221 point merit danny", clicks on a link. page of home owner records comes up. Next to "2221 Point Merit" we see the name "Daniel Goudelin". He searches "danny goudelin", finds an article on a local restaurant with a picture of a MAN standing proudly in fr of "Goudelin’s Eatery". The caption below reads: "Owner/ Proprietor Danny Goudelin". Jeff thinks, begins muttering to himself. We barely hear:

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I had a failed business. I had a business collapse. Well, thanks. It was a restaurant. Um, there was a zoning issue.  145 146 147 Revision 1 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff talks quietly with DANNY who is showing the EMPTY HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: ...thing is my personal credit is mixed up with my business which failed last year. It was leveraged pretty heavily and now there’s no way to separate my social from the restaurant’s tax id. So I thought if you’re open to it we could-

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I actually run a restaurant myself.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You’re kidding. Then you know what I’m talking about.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. Let’s do this though. We can run your wife’s credit, do it in her name. Kris inspects the kitchen, faucet, lights, the TILED FLOO

dialogues.speaker: JEFF, (OFF SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Same situation. But if you’re willing I can pay cash for three months in advance plus last month of the lease...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEWBORN PIGLETS nurse from K. J stands nearby. The weathe is clear here, but far off on the horizon is a DARK CLOUD FRONT. Wesley watches from afar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris takes out the trash. It’s RAINING. A Coworker passes her:

dialogues.speaker: COWORKER
dialogues.text: Take your lunch yet? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 148 149 150 151 CONTINUED: Revision 1 60.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Go ahead. I’1l go when you’re back.

dialogues.speaker: COWORKER
dialogues.text: You’re a true friend, Krissy.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS
dialogues.text: Almost the only friend of human progress. NOTE TO READER: Yeah, that’s weird. We’1ll get to it late

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff lays out REPORTS at each seat around an empty conference table. Intern 1 and 2 should be helping but ta instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wesley pulls a POLE COLLAR off the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The collar goes around J’s head and CINCHES tight. J GRUNTS and SQUEALS as Wesley pulls him to a remote pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff carries a BOX of reports down an aisle. The Interns follow. Jeff is agitated, suspicious of them. He turns:

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: INTERN 1
